Description: Owns the GitHub repository for a project, and leads the academic project (e.g., lead author of a manuscript).
Use Case: Assign tasks to collaborators
Project descritption, citation, DOIs
Set contributor permissions, share code of conduct
Discuss project directions and goals
Approve and incorporate edits to code and/or writing
Trigger archival of code and data and DOI assignment
Share up-to-date reports, figures, or draft manuscript

Description: Contributes to writing and other aspects of research, but may have limited or no experience with programming, git, and/or GitHub.
Use Case: Discuss proposed changes to manuscript
Propose changes involving code (e.g. analyses, figures)
Edit Markdown text or add files

Description: Contributes code to the project (may also contribute to writing and other aspects of research).
Use Case: Contribute changes to code, initiate code review
Contribute to project website
Suggest code changes

Description: Reviews project code (e.g. a co-author or a peer-reviewer). They are familiar with coding, but not necessarily with git or GitHub (but they are willing to learn).
Use Case: Highlight specific lines of code and make suggestions
Review or recommended changes in code
Find all code related to a project

Description: Not involved in the project directly, but wishes to use or adapt data or code for their own analysis.
Use Case: Create a linked, editable copy of the repository
Ask questions about data and code
View project website
Suggest additional features and report bugs
